Package dev.narlyx.ftc.tweetybird

Class TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder

java.lang.Object
dev.narlyx.ftc.tweetybird.TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder
Enclosing class:
TweetyBirdProcessor
public static class TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder extends Object
Used to specify all parameters before starting TweetyBird *required

    • setInchesBetweenSideEncoders

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setInchesBetweenSideEncoders(double inches)
      Distance from the robot's center of rotation to the center of the left encoder wheel. Only 2d, height is not accounted.
      Parameters:
      inches -

    • setInchesToBackEncoder

    • setMinSpeed

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setMinSpeed(double speed)
      The default "speed limit", but for how slow the robot can go. Usually in affect when slowing for corners or the destination.
      Parameters:
      speed - speed value 0-1

    • setMaxSpeed

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setMaxSpeed(double speed)
      The default "speed limit", the robot should never go higher than this speed.
      Parameters:
      speed - speed value 0-1

    • setStartSpeed

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setStartSpeed(double speed)
      Similar to minimum speed but is only used when the robot is at a stand still, it is good to make this value higher than the minimum speed to have a little boost.
      Parameters:
      speed - speed value 0-1

    • setStopForceSpeed

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setStopForceSpeed(double speed)
      When the robot is at a stand still, how much force will be applied to each motor to attempt to maintain its position, to low will mean no force, too high will skid.
      Parameters:
      speed - speed value 0-1

    • setSpeedModifier

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setSpeedModifier(double modifier)
      Used for internal calculations for speed. Speed is found by multiplying the distance by the speed modifier. For example, if the distance from the target is five inches, and the speed modifier is 0.05, the resulting speed (minus other calculations) will be 0.25, or a quarter of the max speed. Only adjust by 0.01 of an inch.
      Parameters:
      modifier - above^

    • setCorrectionOverpowerDistance

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setCorrectionOverpowerDistance(double distance)
      The distance the robot needs to be off of the projected target path before dedicating all its power to get back on track
      Parameters:
      distance - distance in inches

    • setRotationBuffer

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setRotationBuffer(double degrees)
      Sets the amount of degrees off the heading can be off of the target heading and still state that the heading is correct. Setting this value to small will cause the robot to indefinitely try to correct the heading
      Parameters:
      degrees - amount of degrees

    • setDistanceBuffer

      public TweetyBirdProcessor.Builder setDistanceBuffer(double distance)
      Sets the distance the robot can be away from the target distance and still state that the heading is correct. Setting this value too small will cause the robot to indefinitely wiggle to try and reach the target position.
      Parameters:
      distance - distance in inches

    • build

      public TweetyBirdProcessor build()
